meanings.sent1: The magician was ensorceling the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: She was ensorceling him with her beautiful singing.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be ensorceling the mouse with its mesmerizing movements.
meanings.sent4: The enchanting melody ensorceling the listeners into a dreamlike state.
meanings.sent5: The witch's potion had an ensorceling effect on all who drank it.

meanings.definition: The act of casting a spell on someone.
meanings.sent1: The witch's ensorceling of the prince was a tale passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The ensorceling of the village was a dark chapter in its history.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the idea of an ensorceling contest at the magic show.
meanings.sent4: The ensorceling of the land brought about a strange and eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The old book contained secrets of ensorceling that had been forgotten over time.

meanings.definition: Having the power to cast a spell on someone.
meanings.sent1: The sorceress possessed an ensorceling charm that captivated all who met her.
meanings.sent2: The wizard's staff had an ensorceling aura that filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's eyes held an ensorceling gaze that seemed to see into your soul.
meanings.sent4: The forest had an ensorceling beauty that left visitors in awe.
meanings.sent5: The potion emitted an ensorceling fragrance that drew people in.
